Grouped_Utterances: I’m really focused on finding counseling positions. I want to help people, especially those struggling with addiction.

Hi, Ellie! I’m feeling pretty good. I’ve been working on my resume and applying for more jobs. A couple of places reached out, but I haven’t had any interviews yet. Just trying to stay positive. It helps clear my mind. I feel more relaxed when I’m surrounded by nature. It’s peaceful. Yes! I feel lighter, like I can let go of some stress. I think being outside really helps. Well, I had a moment last week when I felt really overwhelmed. I was thinking about my son again and it just hit me hard. I was sitting in my room, and I just started thinking about how long it’s been since I last saw him. I felt a wave of sadness wash over me.  It was about longing and hope. I wrote about the memories I have of him and how I’m waiting for the day we can see each other again.

I remember taking him to the park when he was little. We’d play on the swings and laugh together. Those moments were special. I feel a mix of happiness and sadness. Happy for the memories but sad that I can’t create new ones right now. I hope so. I just want him to know I’m thinking about him.
I think I’ve shared everything on my mind. I’m feeling good about the letter idea and volunteering.

Well, I try to keep myself busy. I write poetry and listen to music. I’ve also been going for walks in the park. I ended up writing a poem about it. It helped me express what I was feeling instead of bottling it up. Definitely. It’s like therapy for me. I can get everything out on paper and then feel lighter afterward. I’ve thought about writing him letters. I could send them to his last known address.  Yes, I think I would. It might help me feel closer to him, even if he doesn’t receive them right away.

That makes sense. I’ll look into local organizations that could use help. I like that idea. I’ll start researching this week. Of course! I’m here for you. Let’s set a goal for our next session. How about you write a letter to your son before we meet again? I can do that. I’ll bring it in to share if I feel comfortable.
